channel.title: Openssl on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Openssl on TLDRBins

item.title: IMAP
item.description: IMAP/IMAPS # Connect to IMAP over ssl rlwrap openssl s_client -connect <TARGET>:993 $ rlwrap openssl s_client -connect 10.10.10.197:993 Connecting to 10.10.10.197 CONNECTED(00000003) Can't use SSL_get_servername depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US verify error:num=18:self-signed certificate verify return:1 depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US verify error:num=10:certificate has expired notAfter=May 14 17:14:21 2021 GMT verify return:1 depth=0 CN=localhost, OU=Automatically-generated IMAP SSL key, O=Courier Mail Server, L=New York, ST=NY, C=US notAfter=May 14 17:14:21 2021 GMT verify return:1 --- Certificate chain 0 ST=NY, C=US a:PKEY: rsaEncryption, 3072 (bit); sigalg: RSA-SHA256 v:NotBefore: May 14 17:14:21 2020 GMT; NotAfter: May 14 17:14:21 2021 GMT --- Server certificate -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- error: certificate has expired --- New, TLSv1.

item.title: Openssl
item.description: Show TLS Certificate from HTTPS web server echo | openssl s_client -showcerts -servername <TARGET> -connect <TARGET>:443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -inform pem -noout -text Show content of a CSR openssl req -in request.csr -noout -text Create Client Certificate 1. Generate a user key openssl genrsa -out user.key 2048 2. Create a CSR openssl req -new -key user.key -out user.csr # Settings +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | You are about to be asked to enter information that will be incorporated | | into your certificate request.
